Definition: Wood cladding for walls or ceilings, often with decorative features
Wood made from a continuous piece of timber, not engineered or layered
Thin layer of wood glued onto a carrier material (e.g. MDF)
Medium-density fiberboard, dimensionally stable and used as a substrate
Shaped trim used for decoration or edge finishing of paneling
Pronounced horizontal molding at the top of a wall or paneling
Narrow vertical strip used to divide or structure paneling fields
Framing element around a door or wall panel
Trim or covering piece to hide raw edges or joins
Hidden fastening element used for invisible installation
Beveled edge for decorative or structural reasons
Scaled drawing of a room from above
3D model showing planned paneling in a room context
Partial payment to confirm order before production starts
Unit of length used for cost estimation and quoting
